doc:
Étienne Decroux https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%89tienne_Decroux 0 Étienne Decroux (19 July 1898 in Paris, France – 12 March 1991 in Boulogne-Billancourt, France) was a French actor who studied at Jacques Copeau's Ecole du Vieux-Colombier, where he saw the beginnings of what was to become his life's obsession–corporeal mime. During his long career as a film and theatre actor, he created many pieces, using the human body as the primary means of expression. Étienne_Decroux ( 19_July_1898 in Paris , France – 12_March_1991 in Boulogne-Billancourt , France ) was a_French_actor who studied at Jacques_Copeau 's_Ecole_du_Vieux-Colombier , where he saw the_beginnings of what was_to_become his_life 's_obsession – corporeal_mime . During his_long_career as a_film_and_theatre_actor , he created many_pieces , using the_human_body as the_primary_means of expression .
